titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. John Bryan, Indictment
CWG4361

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Todd Circuit Court
The Commonwealth of Kentucky
against } Indictment April Term 1863
John Bryan

The Grand Jury of Todd County in the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky accuse John Bryan ^of the crime of^ Feloniously breaking into a store house and stealing merchandise therefrom ^committed as follows^ The said John Bryan on the 28 day of April 1863 in the county aforesaid, did wilfully and feloniously in the night time break into a store house in the posession and control of John D Black in which goods were and mechandise was kept deposited with the intent to steal and feloniously took therefrom six bottles of whiskey the property of said John D. Black of the value of six Dollars against the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

Information given by
Jno D Black
Seth Black
Egbert Garsh
J T Backhonner
J G Roach foreman
Grand Jury
E J Campbell attorney for commonwealth

A Copy
attest
Ben T. Perkins C. T. C. C

Todd Cir Ct
12 months Respite
T E Bramlette
